email_content:
Hi Mark,

Thanks for reaching out.

Below is a concise overview of the standard procedure we follow when handling customer inquiries, along with the protocol for reporting any issues that arise:

1. Verify the customer’s identity using the approved verification methods (e.g., two pieces of ID and the standard security questions).
2. Log the inquiry in the CRM so the interaction is tracked from the start.
3. Resolve the request if it falls within your authority and is covered by routine policy.
4. For questions that require additional support or exceptions, create a ticket with our internal help desk (internal-help@trustwellbank.com) so the case can be routed to the right team.
5. Once resolved, add a brief summary of the outcome to the CRM record so future interactions have the full context.

Issue-reporting protocol
• Capture a brief description of the problem, any relevant account details, and supporting documentation or screenshots.
• Submit the information to the help desk using the same ticketing system noted above.
• If the matter is time-sensitive, refer to the branch-manager contact list for a direct escalation channel.

Additional resources
• “Bank Procedures Overview” (internal wiki) – a quick refresher on the main steps and escalation paths.
• The help-desk knowledge base – searchable articles that address common scenarios.

Let me know if you have any other questions. I’m happy to walk through specific cases or point you to additional materials.

Best regards,
Jane
